Methods

createResource(parentHref, data, callback) → {void}

Creates a new resource on the server as a child of the specified `parentHref` location (must be a collection resource endpoint).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parentHref String the URI of the parent collection under which the new resource will be created as a child. This must always be the first argument.
data Object the resource (name/value pairs) to send to the server.
callback function the callback function to invoke with the constructed Resource. `callback`'s first argument is an `Error`, the second is the constructed resource. `callback` must always be the last argument.
Version:
  • 0.1
Source:
  • ds/DataStore.js, line 305
Returns:
no return value; the acquired resource is instead provided to `callback`.
Type
void

getAuthenticator(options) → {*}

A factory function that inspects any options and returns an appropriate RequestAuthenticator to use to authenticate requests submitted to the API server.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
options object
Properties
Name Type Description
requestAuthenticator Sauthc1RequestAuthenticator | BasicRequestAuthenticator
authenticationScheme string name of auth method that will instantiated
Source:
  • authc/index.js, line 15
Returns:
Type
*

getResource(href, query, instanceCtor, callback) → {void}

Queries the server for a resource by `href`, providing the result to `callback`.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
href String the URI of the resource to acquire. This must always be the first argument.
query Object [optional=undefined] name/value pairs to use as query parameters to `href`
instanceCtor function [optional=InstanceResource] The Constructor function to invoke for any Instance Resource returned by the server. If the resource returned by the server is a single resource, this function is used to construct the resource. If the resource returned by the server is a collection, `instanceCtor` is used to construct each resource in the collection's `items` field.
callback function the callback function to invoke with the constructed Resource. `callback`'s first argument is an `Error`, the second is the constructed resource. `callback` must always be the last argument.
Version:
  • 0.1
Source:
  • ds/DataStore.js, line 96
Returns:
no return value; the acquired resource is instead provided to `callback`.
Type
void

instantiate(InstanceConstructor, data, query, dataStore)

A factory function that creates and returns a new Resource instance. The server is not contacted in any way - this function merely instantiates the object in memory and returns it. Callers are responsible for persisting the returned instance's state to the server if desired.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
InstanceConstructor the specific Resource constructor to call when creating the instance.
data the data acquired from the server
query any query that was provided to the server when acquiring the data
dataStore the dataStore used by the resource to communicate with the server. required for all resources.
Source:
  • resource/ResourceFactory.js, line 21
Returns:
a new Resource memory instance

isAssignableFrom(ctor, toTest)

Returns true if the first constructor function is equal to, or a super of, the second constructor function.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
ctor the constructor function that might be equal to or a super of 'toTest'.
toTest the constructor function to test
Source:
  • utils.js, line 64

valueOf(obj, defaultValopt) → {*}

Ensures 'undefined' is never encountered on value assignment. Works as follows: 1. Return obj if not null or undefined. 2. Then return defaultVal if not null or undefined. 3. Return null as last resort.

Example usage: 

function(someVal) {
  var possiblyNullButNeverUndefined = util.valueOf(someVal.foo);
}
or: 
function(someVal) {
  var fooOrDefaultValueIfFooDoesNotExist = util.valueOf(someVal.foo, 'DefaultVavlue');
}
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
obj
defaultVal <optional>
Source:
  • utils.js, line 46
Returns:
Type
*
